title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Image Editing Tools to Eliminate Multi-App Design Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new **AI-powered image editing tools**—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—directly within its design canvas, allowing designers to complete precision editing tasks without exporting to external applications like Photoshop or Canva.The tools, announced on December 10, 2025, are now available in Figma Design and Figma Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plan users with AI enabled.These features address a persistent workflow bottleneck where designers frequently switch between multiple platforms for routine visual adjustments, particularly background cleanup and asset reformatting.

paragraphs.content: The launch represents Figma's strategic response to competitive pressure from established players like Adobe and Canva, which have offered similar object removal capabilities for years.By consolidating image editing into a unified toolbar alongside existing features like Remove background and Crop, Figma aims to keep creative teams within its platform for a broader range of design tasks.Industry analysts view this as a pivotal step toward transforming Figma from a prototyping tool into a comprehensive visual design hub, with plans to expand these capabilities across additional Figma products throughout 2026.

sections.title: How the Three Tools Address Design Friction Points

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool enables designers to select and remove unwanted elements from images while maintaining the integrity of surrounding visual elements, eliminating the need for background cleanup in dedicated photo editing software.The **Isolate object** feature allows users to extract a subject from its context, then apply targeted effects such as blur, lighting adjustments, desaturation, shadow modifications, or focus changes—all while preserving the original background and color characteristics.Together, these tools eliminate what marketers and content teams identify as one of their most time-consuming workflows: requesting minor edits from design teams or manually exporting and re-importing assets between applications.

paragraphs.content: The **Expand image** tool addresses another common pain point by extending image backgrounds to fit different aspect ratios and formats without distortion, enabling designers to adapt a single asset for use across web headers, mobile layouts, and social media posts.Rather than requiring users to compose new layouts or manually crop content, the tool generates seamless background extensions that maintain visual coherence.Figma's upgraded lasso selector—central to all three tools—ensures precise, stable selections that preserve surrounding colors, lighting, and textures, avoiding the artificial "AI-stretched" appearance that often results from automated editing tools.

sections.title: Workflow Efficiency Gains and Market Positioning

paragraphs.content: Industry analysts emphasize that these tools eliminate a significant source of project delays and cross-team dependencies. ContentGrip notes the features "minimize the common friction of jumping between platforms like Photoshop and Figma for minor visual tweaks," directly benefiting performance marketers seeking faster turnaround on campaign test variations.Techloy describes the update as "practical upgrades that solve everyday design headaches," targeting what it calls the "boring but essential tasks" that slow creative teams down.By enabling in-house edits without requiring a designer's involvement, teams can reduce bottlenecks in design-stage optimization and cross-functional reviews where stakeholders request small adjustments to mockups.

Figma's consolidation of image editing tools into a single, contextual toolbar signals the company's intent to prevent users from switching to competitors for routine tasks.The prominent placement of the Remove background option—identified by Figma as one of its most-used features—reflects the platform's focus on addressing genuine user needs rather than flashy generative capabilities.TechCrunch notes that Figma's launch coincides with Adobe integrating comparable features into ChatGPT, though details remain unclear on whether Figma's new tools will eventually become available within that ecosystem, where Figma became an integration partner in October 2025.
